greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = phi(n) - d(n), where d(n) is the number of divisors function (A000005).
comment: It is known that a(n) >= 1 for n >= 31.
reference: D. S. Mitrinovic et al., Handbook of Number Theory, Kluwer, p. 11.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
program: (PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, write("b063070.txt", n, " ", eulerphi(n) - numdiv(n)) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 16 2009
xref: Cf. A000010, A000005. A020488 gives n such that a(n) = 0.
results.author: _Jason Earls_, Aug 04 2001
